Welcome to Shuffle, a \"Getting Things Done\" inspired personal organization tool. If you want to see how best to use Shuffle, click \"Demonstration\" to load up a bunch of example projects and actions. Later you can start again by selecting \"Delete all\" from the Settings menu.
Or get stuck in straight away with no actions or projects and only the default set of contexts...
See Help menu for additional instructions and tips.

Shuffle is a \"Getting Things Done\" inspired personal organization tool. It lets you quickly enter and categorize \'actions\'. With 5 supported perspectives, you can attack your actions any way you please. \n A simple elegant workflow encourages you to categorize your actions into projects and optionally provide context. This structure lets you to break down formidable projects into individual achievable tasks.\n As a project evolves, clean out old actions as they\'re performed, add new actions and reorder any remaining actions depending on your current priorities.

This is the best place to add your actions. The Inbox is where all actions start off before they are processed. Try to regularly scan the Inbox, analyzing each action and either discard it, do it or assign it to a project.\n Once you\'ve processed the list, select Clean up Inbox from the menu to clear out all the categorized actions from your Inbox.

The Project perspective lists all your projects, and allows you to drill-down into each project to view its actions. In addition to the standard adding, editing and deleting of actions, the project view also supports rearranging actions in the order you intend to complete them. \n Projects, like contexts, can be viewed in two different modes: drill-down or expandable view. In drill down mode, clicking on a project takes you to another screen showing the actions for that project. In expandable mode, clicking a project shows its actions on the same screen.

Contexts are situations in which you intend to perform actions. Shuffle comes with a few standard contexts to get you started: At home, At work, Online, Errands, Contact and Read. 
 Feel free to modify or delete the existing, or add your own contexts that suit your situation.
 
 Like the Projects perspective, contexts can be viewed in either drill-down or expandable mode, configurable via Settings.

Next actions is the best place to look to determine what needs to be done. \n It shows the first action for each of your projects. If you\'ve organized each of your projects actions in the order you intend to complete them, this list quickly shows you the most important actions for you could get started on now.

Due actions lets you keep track of actions you have given an explicit due date. There are 3 views - Today, This Week and This Month each showing actions due for the given time scale. Overdue actions are shown in all views.

A number of aspects of Shuffle are user-configurable. The Settings screen is available from all Perspectives via the menu. 
 List layout - Show projects and contexts in two screens (drill-down) or in a tree structure (expandable). 
 Action appearance - Lets you custom what information to display for actions in each perspective. 
 Clean up - Delete completed actions or delete everything.

Some handy Shuffle features you may not know about:
 1) In any list view, long press on an item to see a menu of options.
 2) Hitting the Back button saves before closing.
 3) Use the Save and New menu to create a bunch of actions in one go.
 4) You can mark an action as complete by swiping your finger over it in a list.
 5) Create a shortcut on the Home Screen to create a new action
